node.title: Elizabeth Warren says she will oppose Jerome Powell’s nomination, even as top Democrats express support.
node.alt: The U.S. Capitol in Washington. Members of Congress were reacting on Monday to President Biden’s decision to nominate Jerome H. Powell for a second term as the chair of the Federal Reserve.
node.description: “I will vote against him,” the senator said in a statement, but other powerful lawmakers said his reappointment would provide economic stability.
node.content: ["Senator Elizabeth Warren, the Massachusetts Democrat, said on Monday that she would not vote to confirm Jerome H. Powell for a second term as chair of the Federal Reserve, citing \u201cfailures on regulation, climate and ethics.\u201d", "Ms. Warren, who has called Mr. Powell \u201ca dangerous man,\u201d had been pushing for President Biden to name Lael Brainard as the next chair of the central bank. Mr. Biden\u2019s decision to name Ms. Brainard to the No. 2 spot at the Fed drew Ms. Warren\u2019s support but she said she would continue to push for additional governors who support aggressive financial regulation.", "\u201cIt\u2019s no secret I oppose Chair Jerome Powell\u2019s renomination, and I will vote against him,\u201d Ms. Warren said in a statement.", "Other powerful Democrats, along with Republican lawmakers expressed. support for Mr. Biden\u2019s decision, saying it would keep the central bank on a steady course and protect its political independence at a time of inflation and economic uncertainty for the country.", "Senator Sherrod Brown, Democrat of Ohio and the chair of the Senate Banking Committee, which oversees the Fed, praised Mr. Powell\u2019s role in helping the labor market heal from the pandemic downturn and giving workers greater bargaining power in terms of higher wages.", "\u201cThe Federal Reserve must continue to help steer our economic recovery in the right direction \u2014 toward full employment and an economy that empowers workers and their families,\u201d Mr. Brown said. \u201cI look forward to working with Powell to stand up to Wall Street and stand up for workers, so that they share in the prosperity they create.\u201d", "Senator Jon Tester, a Montana Democrat, said on Twitter that the decision \u201ca smart move.\u201d", "Mr. Biden\u2019s decision to reappoint Mr. Powell, who was first appointed by former President Donald J. Trump, returns the country to a long tradition in which presidents of both parties have embraced the Fed chairs selected by their predecessors, in an expression of support for the central bank\u2019s political independence. Mr. Trump bucked the tradition, replacing Janet L. Yellen with Mr. Powell in 2018.", "Some progressive Democrats had urged Mr. Biden to also break with tradition and appoint someone else to the role. In addition to Ms. Warren, Senators Sheldon Whitehouse of Rhode Island and Jeff Merkley of Oregon had called for Mr. Powell to be replaced, citing his views on climate change, financial regulation and an ethics scandal at the central bank.", "Mr. Whitehouse said in a statement on Monday that he was \u201cdisappointed\u201d in the decision, adding that Mr. Powell had done too little to address climate change.", "\u201cOur Fed Chair must devote immediate and thorough attention to the climate threat before it is too late,\u201d Mr. Whitehouse said in the statement. \u201cI sincerely hope that, if confirmed, Powell will reassess his past opposition to utilizing the Fed\u2019s regulatory tools to minimize climate-related risks to the financial sector.\u201d", "Americans for Financial Reform, a coalition of community, labor and civil rights groups, called the decision \u201ca major disappointment to those of us who have fought for tougher regulation of Wall Street.\u201d", "Mr. Biden\u2019s decision to nominate Ms. Brainard for vice chair could help mollify some of those concerns. Some progressive groups had been pushing for Ms. Brainard to lead the central bank, in part because of her views on climate change and financial regulation.", "Mr. Whitehouse applauded Ms. Brainard\u2019s nomination in his statement, saying \u201cshe clearly recognizes the gravity of the climate-related financial and economic risks facing our nation and will push the Fed to fully utilize its regulatory authorities in this space.\u201d", "Other groups that have been critical of the Fed expressed support for the picks, particularly Ms. Brainard.", "The Fed Up Campaign, which advocates more accommodative monetary policies and full employment, said the Fed needed \u201cto continue pro-employment, pro-wage growth, pro-racial justice macroeconomic policies for as long as economic conditions allow.\u201d", "\u201cGovernor Brainard is a strong choice for Vice Chair, and we are expecting Biden to continue to name truly bold and pro-worker choices to the vacant governor seats,\u201d the group said.", "Lawmakers also expressed support for the move, though some Republicans expressed concerns about Ms. Brainard, who has pushed for tougher financial regulations.", "Senator Patrick J. Toomey of Pennsylvania, the ranking member on the Senate Banking Committee, said that he disagreed with some of Mr. Powell\u2019s decisions during the crisis, but that he would support his nomination.", "\u201cWhen the pandemic hit in 2020, Chairman Powell acted swiftly and took extraordinary and necessary steps to help stabilize financial markets and the economy,\u201d Mr. Toomey said in a statement.", "The senator expressed \u201cconcerns about regulatory policies that Governor Brainard would support as Vice Chair,\u201d but said looked forward to discussing those issues.", "Both Mr. Powell and Ms. Brainard must win 60 votes in order to be confirmed by the Senate."]
